description:
Gov. Justin Trudeau attempted to be relatable. That was his second mistake of the day. His first mistake was even considering trying to appeal to Canadians. Nonetheless, he did what he believed would make people proud to be Canadian, and saying that was a mistake would be an understatement.

Trudeau shared a patriotic Canadian video with the caption, “Good to have you back," and it’s worse than you think.

Good to have you back. pic.twitter.com/NR6IXqve1O
— Justin Trudeau (@JustinTrudeau) March 6, 2025

Awwwww. Did someone
title: Justin Trudeau attempts to "own" Trump with over-the-top pro-Canada ad, owns himself and his country instead

description:
The left has been desperately trying to regain the votes they lost from the younger generation. However, in doing so, they have demonstrated exactly why no one can relate to them, as their very presence is a cringe-worthy offense.

Someone thought it was a good idea for the Democrats to create a “Choose Your Fighter" video, but they were wrong. That's why Scott Jennings had t
title: Dem tries defending "Choose Your Fighter" video to Scott Jennings, gets lesson in politics instead: "Let me give you some advice"

description:
The main problem with being inclusive is that it often results in excluding the majority of the population. While the left claims to stand for everything, they actually stand for nothing. This is why one can never be Progressive enough, as the goalpost continuously shifts to the left. Although males competing in girls' sports was never up for discussion, the left now demands the elimination of female sports under the pretext of “inclusivity.”

If you dare to question this lack of logic, they cancel you into oblivion as if you were literally Hitler. This is also why they can’t jump on the podcast bandwagon, as these people cancel each other if your Ukraine flag is too small.

Joe Rogan and Andrew Schulz talked about why the left could never podcast even if their lives depended on it.
title: Joe Rogan, Andrew Schulz switch off wrecking the left's attempts to build their own podcast network: "You’re in a suicide cult"

description:
It’s time for a pop-culture catch-up: New York Police Department Officer Melissa Mercado was busted for twerking when co-workers recognized her in S-Quiere’s rap music video, we’ve got the most absurd highlights from last Sunday’s 97th Academy Awards, Disney’s woke live action remakes, Mug Club Movie Reviews, our new What We've Missed segment, and more!

SOURCES

  • NYPD detective under fire over raunchy pole-dancing video: ‘I have no words’
title: What We've Missed | A Pop Culture Catch-Up

description:
We all out here on the internets had a hearty guffaw on Thursday at the expense of House Democrats. They claimed to be "fighters" in steaming pile of content, but we were the ones fighting peeing our pants from laughing at them so hard. So, as you can imagine, the most online president in the history of all the United States of America had thoughts on the matter. The White House dropped a response video and, if I may quote popular videogame vernacular, FATALITY!

Let's recap the original video. It isn't the first time that politicians have attempted to hop on a social media trend. But as you watch this, keep in mind something I had learned about this video yesterday. The "fighter" video was a trend from THREE YEARS AGO,
title: Donald Trump obliterates that cringetastic Democrat "fighter" video in the most MAGA way possible
